meanings.definition: Covering with a thin layer of gold.
meanings.sent1: She carefully overgilded the picture frame with gold paint.
meanings.sent2: The artist decided to overgild the edges of the mirror for a luxurious look.
meanings.sent3: The overgilding of the cake with edible gold flakes made it look like a treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overgilded the room with joy and warmth.
meanings.sent5: The setting sun overgilded the clouds with a golden hue.

meanings.sent1: The overgilding on the chandelier made it sparkle like a treasure.
meanings.sent2: The overgilding details on the dress added a touch of elegance.
meanings.sent3: The overgilding Christmas tree was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her overgilding jewelry collection was the envy of all her friends.
meanings.sent5: The overgilding sunlight bathed the room in a warm glow.

meanings.sent1: He tends to overgild his paintings with gold leaf for a dramatic effect.
meanings.sent2: The decorator warned against overgilding the furniture as it might overpower the room.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally overgilded the dessert with gold dust, creating a unique presentation.
meanings.sent4: Her words overgilded the truth, making it hard to distinguish fact from fiction.
meanings.sent5: The overgilding of the garden gate transformed it into a majestic entrance.
